On the Wednesday edition of Breitbart News Daily, broadcast live on SiriusXM Patriot Channel 125 from 6AM to 9AM EST, host and Breitbart News Executive Chairman Stephen K. Bannon will be joined by co-host and Breitbart Editor in Chief Alex Marlow live in Rome with Breitbart’s Rome correspondent Dr. Tom Williams.

SiriusXM Vice President for news and talk Dave Gorab called the show “the conservative news show of record.”

Follow Breitbart News on Twitter for live updates during the show.
Speaker Paul Ryan’s primary challenger Paul Nehlen will discuss what’s being characterized as Ryan’s “first big victory as Speaker” – the deal to bailout Puerto Rico.
Michael Pack, director of the documentary “The Last 600 Meters,” will discuss the latest operation to free war-torn Fallujah – this time from the grip of ISIS.
Live from London, Rome, and Jerusalem, Breitbart correspondents will provide updates on the latest international news.
We’ll also hear from Frank Gaffney of the Center for Security Policy who will discuss Obama’s trip to Vietnam.
Breitbart News Daily is the first live conservative radio enterprise to air seven days a week.
Listeners may call into the show at: 866-957-2874.
